He's spitting fire like his poro icon.
{{champion:96}} I'm spitting out something else

Just imagine this: When league esports is growing big as other sports, probably every college will offer scholarship program. In high school there will be varsities competing each other. There will be a NCAA national league of legends tournament, everyone would create a bracket to predict the tournament outcome. Because there are way too many league players want to go pro, there will be lcs draft. Just imagine:"With the first pick of 2016 lcs draft, Team Liquid select..."
Just imagine, when the esport franchise grow as big as NBA franchise, would every esport team have there own Arena? Would there be thousands of fans wearing the same colored shirt, cheering for their home team in lcs playoffs? Would there be full coverage of lcs playoff on national tv? 
Mark my words, all this thing is going to be reality in next 40 years. If after 40 years this DO become reality, just find this post, find this comment, and upvote this, and call me a prophet.
If all this imagination will not become reality, there will be a live stream featuring cutting my dick off.
Mark my words.
league will probably die before this happens
League Will Never Die.
Is league going to leave us? ;-;
I mean tetris is still a popular game among the elderly and some middle aged... Maybe League is the new tetris for our generation?
I will be playing League in my nursing home.
and you will be calling other elderly men and women, scrubs and will be telling them to get rekt.
National Collegiate **Athletic** Association

NCSA
National Collegiate Sitting Association
I await the live stream.
You do understand that there is no difference between league players and "Athletes." League players sustain injury, they practice longer than athletes do, the list goes on.

>You do understand that there is no difference between league players and "Athletes." 

LMFAOOOOOOOO

The only people that would ever say this are people that have never played a sport past 11/12 year old leagues. League players are literally the equivalent of chess or poker players. It's a mind sport. I don't think the NCAA includes mind sports, but I could be wrong. It's has "athletic" for a reason.
ur a prophet m8
This is not VGHS{{champion:51}}
My teacher already plays worlds on the projector. Only get to see an 1 and a half of it but its great!

I do believe esports will grow in popularity, but if you look at soccer in the united states you get a pretty good representation of how foreign sports grow in U.S. schools. Soccer is way more popular than league across the world, and its growth is still very slow here. While all this would be great, 40 years is pretty short for the kind of changing you are talking about.

Soccer hasn't grown in popularity here because we have football.

Which hey, if baby-backed bitches keep suing the NFL because they're pretending that they didn't know putting on helmets and hitting each other can lead to injuries, and because the millions they made just wasn't quite enough, then the NFL will be forced to turn into flag football and soccer will probably become more popular.

"Would there be thousands of fans wearing the same colored shirt, cheering for their home team in lcs playoffs?"

I don't know where you've been, but this is already happening.
So that's why I got declined from this school last week... Maybe if I hit challenger they will reconsider me.

who know perhaps games can help the younger generations all be friends and stop discrimination. perhaps im a bit 2 naive

sadlife... got rejected :( it was my #1 too.... well, here's to another reason to transfer to uci in 2 years!
Mind if I ask your GPA and ACT/SAT scores? Looking to apply but I wanna know if I'm wasting my time.
Hey, I'm a senior and I was just accepted to UCI not long ago and I'm planning to attend. I have a 4.2 GPA with 1990 SAT. It depends by major but I am majoring in electrical engineering.
Weighted GPA
Weighted GPAs are for bitches....though not your fault.
You have something negative to say about everyone's post, does the world care what you think? I think not.
As a student at UCI, I couldn't be happier with this announcement. GPA 3.6, SAT 2000, ACT 33. Can probably still get in with a tad lower scores.
